Package de.goldkugel.etl.extract.basic

Interface Extract

All Superinterfaces:
Configurable, ETLComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
CSVExtract, DBExtract, TXTExtract
public interface Extract extends ETLComponent
This class only extracts data from a source. Please do not implement any data transformation processes in here for example changing data format. Also data quality assessments for example data type should not be performed in here but in the transport component. Usually the data is assumed to be in tabular format.
Author:
Peter Pallaoro

  • Method Details

    • readCell

      int readCell(@NonNull List<Object[]> l)
      Reads only one cell from the source. The data of the cell will be added to the given list l. Since only one cell will be read an array of length one will be added to the given list. If no cell is available no element will be added to the list. Data can only be saved if the given list is not null, therefore a non null list should be provided. It is recommended to hand over always an empty list but there are exceptions where this advice should not be followed.
      Parameters:
      l - : the list in which the read data is stored in.
      Returns:
      the return value should be zero if the reading was successful, if the return value is above zero, warnings have occurred, while if the return value is below zero, errors occurred. It is recommended to hand over always an empty list but there are exceptions where this advice should not be followed.

    • readCells

      int readCells(@NonNull List<Object[]> l, @NonNull Integer amount)
      Reads multiple amount of cells in the source. The amount of cells which shall be read can be defined by the second parameter. The data of the cell will be added to the given list l. An array of cells will be added to the list with the read cells, each array element contains exactly one cell. There is the possibility, that fewer cells could be read than requested for example when only one cell is available but three have been requested. If no cell is available no element will be added to the list. Data can only be saved if the given list is not null, therefore a non null list should be provided. It is recommended to hand over always an empty list but there are exceptions where this advice should not be followed. Please avoid to call "readCell" multiple times. This method should save process time and memory by reading multiple cells at the same time.
      Parameters:
      l - : the list in which the read data is stored in.
      amount - : the amount of cells which should be read.
      Returns:
      the return value should be zero if the reading was successful, if the return value is above zero, warnings have occurred, while if the return value is below zero, errors occurred.

    • readRow

      int readRow(@NonNull List<Object[]> l)
      Reads one entire line of cells from the source. The data of those cells will be added to the given list l. An array of cells will be added to the list with the read cells, each array element contains exactly one cell. If no cell or no row is available no element will be added to the list. Data can only be saved if the given list is not null, therefore a non null list should be provided. It is recommended to hand over always an empty list but there are exceptions where this advice should not be followed.
      Parameters:
      l - : the list in which the read data is stored in.
      Returns:
      the return value should be zero if the reading was successful, if the return value is above zero, warnings have occurred, while if the return value is below zero, errors occurred.

    • readRows

      int readRows(@NonNull List<Object[]> l, @NonNull Integer amount)
      Reads multiple amount of rows in the source. The amount of rows which shall be read can be defined by the second parameter. The data of the rows will be added to the given list l. An array of cells will be added to the list for each row containing the read cells, each array element contains exactly one cell, each array exactly one row. If no cell or no row is available no element will be added to the list. Data can only be saved if the given list is not null, therefore a non null list should be provided. It is recommended to hand over always an empty list but there are exceptions where this advice should not be followed. Please avoid to call "readRow" multiple times. This method should save process time and memory by reading multiple rows at the same time.
      Parameters:
      l - : the list in which the read data is stored in.
      amount - : the amount of rows which should be read.
      Returns:
      the return value should be zero if the reading was successful, if the return value is above zero, warnings have occurred, while if the return value is below zero, errors occurred.
